FuncDef:
The authening authen-redirect online authen-domain command configures a redirection domain when the user quota is used up.
The undo authening authen-redirect command cancels a configured redirection domain.
By default, no redirection domain is configured in the authentication scheme.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a redirection domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters excluding *, ?, and ". The letters in the name are case-insensitive.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the user quota is used up. In this case, the device redirects users to the domain allowing the users to go online through this domain.
In actual applications, you can configure a pool of private network IP addresses, user ACL-based access rights, and security domains in a redirection domain. In this manner, you can configure and isolate allocation of Internet and private network IP addresses, access rights in a differentiated manner. This saves Internet IP addresses and prevents users from occupying a great number of Internet IP addresses through illegal attacks.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
